edu.illinois.cs.cs125.fall2019.mp

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.cs.cs125.fall2019.mp.Game

  • public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a multiplayer game, providing or defining methods common to all game modes.

    This is used starting in Checkpoint 4. It does not need to be modified until Checkpoint 5.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String setEmail,
            com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap setMap,
            com.neovisionaries.ws.client.WebSocket setWebSocket,
            com.google.gson.JsonObject initialState,
            android.content.Context setContext)
        Sets up this Game.
        Parameters:
        setEmail - the user's email (from Firebase)
        setMap - the Google Maps view to render to
        setWebSocket - the websocket to send events to
        initialState - the "full" update from the server
        setContext - the Android UI context

    • Method Detail

      • getEmail

        protected final java.lang.String getEmail()
        Gets the user's email address.

        This method is here to expose the private email variable to subclasses.

        Returns:
        the current user's email

      • getMap

        protected final com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap getMap()
        Gets the Google Maps view used by this Game.

        This method is here to expose the private map variable to subclasses.

        Returns:
        the Google Maps control to render to

      • getContext

        protected final android.content.Context getContext()
        Gets the UI context.

        This method is here to expose the private context variable to subclasses.

        Returns:
        an Android UI context

      • sendMessage

        protected final void sendMessage(java.lang.String text)
        Sends a message to the server.
        Parameters:
        text - serialized JSON to send

      • sendMessage

        protected final void sendMessage(com.google.gson.JsonObject message)
        Sends a message to the server.

        Subclasses can use this to send updates via the websocket.

        Parameters:
        message - JSON object to send

      • locationUpdated

        public abstract void locationUpdated(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng location)
        Processes a location change, makes appropriate changes to the game state, and sends appropriate notifications to the server.

        Subclasses should implement this in a way specific to the mode of game they represent.

        Parameters:
        location - a location FusedLocationProviderClient is reasonably confident about

      • getTeamScore

        public abstract int getTeamScore(int teamId)
        Gets a team's score.

        Subclasses should implement this in a way specific to their game mode's type of objective.

        Parameters:
        teamId - the team ID
        Returns:
        how many objectives the team has captured

      • handleMessage

        public boolean handleMessage(com.google.gson.JsonObject message,
                             java.lang.String type)
        Processes an update from the server.

        This implementation handles playerLocation and playerExit events, updating the player circles appropriately. Subclass implementations should handle events specific to their game mode, delegating others to this implementation with a super call.

        Parameters:
        message - JSON from the server
        type - the update type
        Returns:
        whether the message was handled

      • getMyTeam

        public final int getMyTeam()
        Gets the user's team ID in this game.
        Returns:
        team ID as defined in TeamID
